text: [Music]
and I've always loved fashion like I
think I've never considered anything
else that I wanted to do with my life
but to kind of create clothes and play
dress-up and you know and give something
women and men and whatever love to wear
in the last five years New York Fashion
Week has become a haven for young
designers as every season it seems like
there's another next big thing for
everyone to chase after now that the
economy is in tatters however everyone
is wondering how many of them can
survive this is Eric Wilson of the New
York Times I met up with Alexander Wang
one of the most promising of the new
designers at Barneys New York we talked
about how fashion is changing and the
pressure is now facing his industry like
many of his peers Proenza Schouler Zac
Posen and Jason Wu for example mr. Wang
couldn't wait to start his own business
and did so right out of college he
started selling clothes in 2004 when he
was only 20 now he designs two
collections each season plus handbags
shoes and jewelry and he's starting
menswear next spring I think you know we
started doing knitwear our first season
um we wanted to you know my
sister-in-law she's you know I'm lucky
to have her she's very very business -
so we always decided that you know we
wanted to start small and something that
was maintainable and that we could
handle so we had like six samples that
was our first collection and we sold it
on consignment to a couple of stores and
within the first week they sold out and
then we realized whoa you know a product
that's actually selling and what's your
look I mean how do you define what it is
that you're you're trying to put out
there um you know I think the thing
about our brand and and the clothes I
create or you know it's a very specific
point of view when we show it and when
we talk about it and when we present it
each season and to kind of give it a
direction but I think the most important
thing is that people can relate to it
and and adapt to it and kind of take it
apart and make it their own and style it
and I think that kind of creative
freedom is is what creates our block
Julie kill heart the fashion director of
Barneys has an incredible eye for new
talent and an
instinct for which designers have the
wherewithal to succeed she too is
concerned about what the future holds
for many small designers but it's the
real talent that I think I'll shine
because they'll figure out how to
navigate through and those are the
people that we really want to support
and those are the people that were
focusing on you know Alex I keep saying
slow down slow there because that he's
just so good at everything he does does
it scare you and someone like Julie says
don't run don't run
it does it does cuz you're always like
oh my gosh am i doing it too quickly you
know and but you know so far you know I
mean of course we've made a lot of
mistakes too and then sometimes when
you're when you're in the public eye you
know it's harder to kind of get away
from it but I think for the most part
every step that we've added on and that
we've taken has brought us to a better
place well what do you think's going to
happen with fashion in general in the
coming years you know I was thinking
about this the other day and and I think
you know if you look at the history of
fashion and how the industry kind of
built upon itself and you know before
when there was a group of you know five
designers that were kind of like setting
the trends and the direction of fashion
now there's hundreds and I think you
know now when you read fashion magazines
it's kind of like one magazine saying
this is it and this is that and then
this was magazine saying that's in and
that's out I think it's just about the
future fashion is really people are so
gonna not follow a single route or trend
anymore it's about really finding what's
comfortable within themselves what makes
them feel good what they like to wear
and go into those designers for that if
you ask if you have any theories as to
why there's so much interest in you new
things in fashion you know they want
something that they they can't find
everywhere they want that discovery you
know they want to feel like they found
something special and then they buy it
they wear then they're special when they
go out
[Music]
